meanings.definition: To fasten or seal with epoxy resin.
meanings.sent1: I epoxied the broken vase back together.
meanings.sent2: She epoxied the pieces of the puzzle to make it whole again.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef epoxied the spatula to the countertop by mistake.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work is like how a sculptor epoxies each piece of a masterpiece together.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut epoxied the equipment before the spacewalk to ensure it stayed in place.

meanings.definition: Covered or coated with epoxy resin.
meanings.sent1: The epoxied table had a shiny and smooth surface.
meanings.sent2: The epoxied floor was easy to clean and maintain.
meanings.sent3: The epoxied walls of the garage gave it a modern and sleek look.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and flawless as an epoxied surface.
meanings.sent5: The epoxied model airplane gleamed under the sunlight at the competition.
